definition: lit. no antidote is possible (idiom); incurable/incorrigible/beyond redemption
not to have/no/none/not/to lack/un-/-less
can/may/able to/to approve/to permit/to suit/(particle used for emphasis) certainly/very
see 可汗[ke4 han2]
to save/to assist/to rescue
medicine/drug/substance used for a specific purpose (e.g. poisoning, explosion, fermenting)/CL:種|种[zhong3],服[fu4],味[wei4]/to poison

sentences.english: He is still, in the eyes of some, an irredeemable misogynist.
sentences.chinese: 在某些人的眼裏，他仍然是個無可救藥的厭惡女性者。

sentences.english: And third, I was unconditionally and irrevocably in love with him. ----from.
sentences.chinese: 第三，我毫無條件地，也無可救藥地愛上了他。

sentences.english: India is also hopelessly outflanked in the arms race.
sentences.chinese: 此外，印度還無可救藥的陷入了軍備競賽。

sentences.english: Go to the library on weekends? You are a certifiable bookworm.
sentences.chinese: 週末還去圖書館？你真是一個無可救藥的書呆子。

sentences.english: You must know by now that he's quite hopeless.
sentences.chinese: 如今你總該知道他是完全無可救藥了。

sentences.english: Was he seized at the age of forty-six with a supreme madness?
sentences.chinese: 四十六歲，他便害了無可救藥的狂病嗎？

sentences.english: He just insanely believes he's Napoleon.
sentences.chinese: 他無可救藥地認爲自己是拿破崙。

sentences.english: He remained gloomy, narrow and hopelessly addicted to conventional wisdom.
sentences.chinese: 他依舊陰鬱，險隘，無可救藥地醉心於傳統的智慧中。

sentences.english: Such are the intricate thought processes of the irredeemably foolish.
sentences.chinese: 就是這些傻得無可救藥的想法纏繞着我。

sentences.english: But the weakening of the English seemed irremediable.
sentences.chinese: 但是英軍的困憊看來是無可救藥的。

sentences.english: For father and myself she was incurably ambitious.
sentences.chinese: 對於她的父親和我是無可救藥雄心勃勃。

sentences.english: My Lord, he's hopelessly out of date.
sentences.chinese: 上帝，他是無可救藥地過時了。

sentences.english: They're a hopeless mess. They get everything wrong.
sentences.chinese: 簡直糟糕得無可救藥，真是成事不足敗事有餘。

definition: to obstinately persist in going about things the wrong way (idiom)
the moth flies into the flame/fatal attraction
lit. wading in mud and water/a slovenly job/sloppy
covered all over with cuts and bruises/beaten black and blue/be a mass of bruises
to ask for trouble/to invite difficulties
fickle in love/sentimentality
ill-fated relationship
perfectionist
to cease to be faithful
bottomless pit
man of Qǐ fears the sky falling (idiom); groundless fears
(coll.) to enjoy showing off
to disdain as beneath contempt (idiom)
lit. win an inch, want a foot (idiom); fig. not satisfied with small gains/give him an inch, and he'll want a mile
lit. love the house and its crow (idiom); involvement with sb and everyone connected/Love me, love my dog.
fig. restless, because of fear or strong emotions
